intro: Hulsea californica, commonly known as California hulsea, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and oval-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is found in coastal and inland regions. It has a low, spreading growth habit and is often used in native plant gardens. Hulsea californica is adapted to Mediterranean climates and thrives in full sun.
